CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 8 - Right to respect for private and family life (Article 8-1 - Respect for home)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE a new block of flats was commissioned by LAW , GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . According to the documents submitted by ORG to state registration authorities , on DATE the ORG of Ufa recognised his title to the flat at DATE , GPE , GPE . The state registration authorities registered ORG ’s title .
CARDINAL . On DATE U. sold the flat to M. On DATE the state registration authorities registered the said transaction and ORG ’s title to the flat .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON , acting on PERSON ’s behalf by virtue of the power of attorney , and the applicant signed a contract according to which ORG sold the flat to the applicant . PERSON and the applicant submitted the documents for the registration of the transaction and the transfer of the title to the flat to the applicant .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , she paid the amount due under the contract to ORG and moved into the flat while her application for the registration of the transfer of the title to the flat to her was still pending .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date a third party brought a civil action challenging U. ’s sale of the flat to PERSON and the latter ’s title to the flat .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG issued an injunction in respect of the transactions with the flat .

CARDINAL . On DATE the state registration authorities informed the applicant that her application for the registration of the transfer of the title to the flat could not be granted pending the outcome of the civil proceedings concerning the title to the flat .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the third party ’s claims in respect of the flat in full .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date ORG GPE brought a civil claim seeking , inter alia , the invalidation of PERSON ’s title to the flat and the applicant ’s eviction .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted the claims in full . It invalidated the purchase of the flat by PERSON and ordered the applicant ’s eviction . The court considered that the applicant had not acquired the title to the flat and had no legal basis for moving into the flat and residing there .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of DATE on appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s cassation appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE rejected the applicant ’s second cassation appeal .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant asked ORG to stay the eviction proceedings . She submitted that the flat had been her only place of residence and that , in view of her financial situation , she was unable to buy or rent another flat . On DATE ORG stayed the eviction proceedings for DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was evicted .
